question_text:
Question 46 
[Geotechnical Engineering : Origin of Soil & Their Properties]
Which of the following statement(s) is/are CORRECT ? 
 
(A) Swell potential of soil decreases with an increase in the shrinkage limit. 
 
 
(B) Both loose and dense sands with different initial void ratios can attain similar void ratio at large
strain during shearing. 
 
(C) Among the several corrections to be applied to the SPT-N value, the dilatancy correction is applied
before all other corrections. 
 
 
(D) In electrical resistivity tomography, the depth of current penetration is half of the spacing between
the electrodes.  
Ans. (A, B)
explanation_text:
Sol.
 
• 
A state when the decrease in moisture content leads to solid state, no change in volume of soil mass is 
observed, the consistency of soil changes from semi-solid to solid state, the boundary water content is 
called shrinkage limit. Shrinkage limit is the smallest value of water content at which soil mass is 
completely saturated. It means that below shrinkage limit, soil is partially saturated.
• 
Higher is the shrinkage limit lower is the compressibility (volume change).
• 
Dilatancy correction is applied to the already corrected N-values for overburden pressure.
• 
At large value of shearing strain, both the initially loose and initially dense sands approach a constant 
value of void ratio called critical void ratio.
Hence, the correct options are (A) and (B).
